article:
A 'memorandum of agreement' (MOA) or 'cooperative agreement' is a document
written between parties to cooperate on an agreed upon project or meet an agreed
objective. The purpose of an MOA is to have a written understanding of the
agreement between parties.

An MOA is a good tool to use for many heritage projects. It can be used between
agencies, the public and the federal or state governments, communities, and
individuals. An MOA lays out the ground rules of a positive cooperative effort.
It is an agreement b/w two parties which bound to each other upto a certain
projects, because it has certain constraints to both the parties.
